name: Hardest 5.25 "A House Is Not a Home" Trivia Quiz | 'Cheers'- Season 5 | 10 Questions

questions.correct: He was glad he was not Carla
questions.explanation:
He was glad he was not Carla.

	Carla asked Woody what he could find to be happy about because she had so many problems. He replied, "I'm glad I'm not you."

Diane.

	Diane not only found the house, she also made a payment on the house to buy it. Sam was upset when he found out until he saw how great the house was.

questions.text: Who said, "You'd never catch a woman of mine leading me around by the nose"?
questions.explanation:
Cliff.

	Carla responded, "No, but you might catch her sunning herself on a rock". Cliff was referring to Sam doing what Diane wanted.

questions.text: What did Sam and Diane find at the new house?
questions.explanation:
the old owners.

	The old owners were a little old couple who spent 50 years in the house. They did not want to leave.

Dogs Playing Blackjack.

	"Dogs Playing Poker" was a series of paintings done by C.M. Coolidge. Diane hated the painting but Sam loved it because it made him laugh.

questions.text: Who did Norm see in front of his office?
questions.explanation:
Robert Urich.

	Robert Urich was not actually seen on the show in this episode. In a later episode, he did make a cameo appearance. Robert Urich was born December 19, 1946 and passed away April 16, 2002 from a rare form of cancer.

questions.text: What did Sam and Diane do for the former owners of the house?
questions.correct: Threw them one last Christmas party
questions.explanation:
Threw them one last Christmas party.

	The couple was sad because they wouldn't be able to celebrate their 50th Christmas in the house. So Sam and Diane threw them a Christmas party even though it was summertime.

questions.text: Who was the musician of the old couples' family?
questions.explanation:
David.

	David was played by Marc Smollin. He was one of the old couple's grandchildren.

questions.text: What did Diane say they'd make an annual event?
options: Birthday parties for all the kids and grandkids
questions.explanation:
Easter egg hunt.

	At this point, Sam had had enough. He said no egg hunts. Sam told them that he and Diane owned the house now and it was time they started to live their lives in it.

questions.text: What room did Sam and Diane pick to "polish the floors" in?
questions.explanation:
Dining room.

	When they went into the dining room, Sam started to laugh. Diane then took the "Dogs Playing Poker" picture out of the room so he'd stop.
